argumentsAndDecisions.complaintSummary: Gas heater malfunction and landlord's failure to repair, causing tenant to rely on electric heater
argumentsAndDecisions.violatedCode: Cal. Code Regs. Tit. 25, § 34 and CSFRA Section 1710(b)(1)
argumentsAndDecisions.reimbursement: $1,174.73 ($77.00 for electric heater + $1,097.73 for rent reductions)
argumentsAndDecisions.respondentHadNotice: Yes, multiple notices including texts on April 29, 2021 and April 22, 2023
argumentsAndDecisions.evidenceAssessment: PG&E evaluation found no dangerous gas levels but confirmed gas leak. Landlord failed to fix despite promises and notices.
argumentsAndDecisions.impactAssessment: Tenant had to purchase electric heater and was without proper heating services for extended period
